Description: Thin rectangular double-end scraper: of brown flint, sharpened by delicate chipping at each end.
Curator's comments: Bears excavators mark. O. The flints 68755-69 are recorded in the registers of the British and Medieval Department as coming from the tomb of Djet, but 10 of this group definitely come from the tomb of Djer, and it is almost certain that the same is true of the remaining 5. See W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), 8, pl.XIV, group O.
